abstract: In this issue, Wang et al., 2015 describes that WT1 recruits TET2 to the DNA, an important feature of a new regulatory pathway linked to the development of acute myeloid leukemia (AML). This pathway consists of WT1, IDH1/2, and TET2 (WIT) genes, with exclusive mutations of the three genes inducing myeloid cell proliferation.
title: A new path to leukemia with WIT.
